quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Space and Song
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, cape. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This soul singer recorded the song Dock of the Bay  in 1967,  three days prior to his death in a plane crash.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Otis Redding

questions.question: Which Major League Baseball pitcher was nicknamed, The Spaceman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Lee

questions.question: He invented the vulcanized rubber double-tube tire in 1845 and the glass fountain pen in 1849. He also came up with the technique of firing explosive charges using electricity.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert William Thomson

questions.question: In 1908, this caricaturist, regarded as the father of French animation, made the film Fantasmagorie, which is considered the first fully-animated film ever made.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emile Cohl

questions.question: He was arrested and imprisoned in 1849 for engaging in revolutionary activity against the ruler, but became one of his countrys greatest writers.
British aircraft manufacturer, Saunders Roe, developed the first practical man-carrying hovercraft, the SR-N1. Its first public demonstration, including a cross-channel run, was made in what year?
This satellite, launched from Cape Canaveral on January 31, 1958, by the Jupiter-C vehicle, was the first United States Earth satellite.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Explorer I

questions.question: Find the next number in this sequence: 8, 5, 4, 9, 1, 7, ...
This psychiatrist, founder of Analytical Psychology, made the following observation:  The more critical reasoning dominates, the more impoverished life becomes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carl Jung

questions.question: Famous for his work, The Exploration of Cosmic Space by Means of Reaction Devices, he is considered the father of human space flight and the first man to conceive the space elevator -- a hypothetical structure designed to transport material from a planets surface into space.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Konstantin Tsiolkovsky

questions.question: Name the longest continuous stretch of railroad.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Trans-Siberian Railroad

questions.question: In what year did Capt. John Alcock and Lt. A.W. Brown make the first nonstop transatlantic flight?
This pop singer, songwriter and pianist, who attended the highly regarded Julliard School of Music, recorded two different versions of the song Breaking Up Is Hard to Do.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neil Sedaka

questions.question: He was ridiculed for preparing in 1863 the first periodic table of the elements arranged in order of relative atomic masses, and pointing out in 1865 the law of octaves, where every eighth element has similar properties.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Newlands

questions.question: It was a war fought because a  Prussian prince was put on the Spanish throne.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Franco-Prussian War

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Fantasticks

questions.question: The terms ahimsa and satyagraha  are generally associated with whom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mahatma Gandhi

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Child labor vis-a-vis interstate commerce

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Issac Barrow

questions.question: This woman, who was the second wife and queen consort of Henry VIII, is said to have become a headless ghost after her death.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anne Boleyn

questions.question: U.S. President Hardings administration was rocked by this scandal, involving oil.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Teapot Dome

questions.question: The Golden State Warriors of the NBA once traded a player and a draft choice for center, Billy Joel Carroll.  Who were the two players they traded?

options.text: Cliff Hagan and Easy Ed MCCauley

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Parrish and Kevin McHale

questions.question: The first Europeans to see this beautiful Caribbean island were on the boat of  Alonzo Pinzon, who separated from Columbus to explore on his own, in 1492. It is the smallest of the Greater Antilles.  What island is it ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Puerto Rico

questions.question: King Richard III killed his two nephews, which were later reported to have been seen as ghosts. What were their names?

options.text: Michael of Knottinghamm and Richard of Shrewsbury
Edward V of England and Richard of Shrewsbury
Edward the V of England and Michael of Knottinghamm
Edward of Shrewsbury and Richard the V of England

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edward V of England and Richard of Shrewsbury

questions.question: The ghost of Archbishop of Canterbury Thomas Becket appeared during the construction of the Twin Towers in the 1920s.

The states of Arizona, Utah, New Mexico and Colorado form an exception to what important mathematical theorem?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Four Color Theorem

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Ghost and Life
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, discovery, hill. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The catch phrase, The Truth Is Out There originated from which of these popular television series, dealing with mysteries and extraterrestrial life?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The X-Files

questions.question: Extraterrestrial life may be closer than we think. Which of these natural satellites of Saturn is believed to have suitable conditions for existence of life?
Due to Silicons similarity with Carbon, some scientists have proposed the possibility of Silicon-based life. Which popular TV production propagated the idea?

options.text: The Day the Earth Stood Still
Close Encounters of the Third Kind

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Star Trek

questions.question: Biggin Hill in London, that is said to be haunted by ghosts, was what kind of war location in the past?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: World War II airbase

questions.question: How did the alien invasion in Herbert Wells well-known science fiction novel, The War of the Worlds eventually come to a halt?

options.text: All nations united and together, repelled the invasion.
The aliens were unexpectedly killed by a terrestrial disease.
The alien invaders took possession of Earth.
Aliens and humans reached an agreement to coexist on Earth.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The aliens were unexpectedly killed by a terrestrial disease.

questions.question: The Museum of Natural Science in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada is said to be haunted by the ghost of the Canadian Prime Minister Sir Wilfrid Laurier, whose body laid there for some time after his death in 1919.
The Lamian Gardens of Rome are often claimed to be haunted by the ghost of the Roman Emperor Caligula, who died in what way?
In ufology, what does the black triangle phenomenon refer to?

options.text: Strange triangular marks on Mars surface
Inexplicable black marks found on rock
A triangular area of frequent UFO or other unusual phenomena sightings

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A type of triangular-shaped UFO

questions.question: The Roswell UFO incident involves the discovery of debris of an alleged extraterrestrial space ship, which had crashed into a field near Roswell, New Mexico, USA. In which year did this happen?
In ufology, how many kinds of close encounters are there in J. Allen Hyneks classification system for observation and interaction with extraterrestrial intelligence within 150 meters (500 feet)?
Crop circles, the cause of many contending believes, were adapted by a creative Swedish company for this rather rational purpose.
Berkeley Universitys, Search For Extraterrestrial Intelligences project , SETI@Home, is an experiment open for everyone to join. What is SETI@Homes aim?

options.text: To bring an alien to each volunteers home
To place radio telescopes at volunteers homes
To use free processing time in volunteers computers to analyze radio data
To train volunteers for space missions

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To use free processing time in volunteers computers to analyze radio data

questions.question: The ghost of the 16th President of the United States Abraham Lincoln is reported to be one of the ghosts that haunt the White House.
The former prison island of Alcatraz, situated off the coast of San Francisco, is said to be the home to a number of ghosts of prisoners who died there.
The ghost of Lady Jane Grey is known as The Nine Days Queen because of the violent ending of her life.
